main.name: Raham Arshad
main.bio: Hello! I'm Raham, a Bachelor of Applied Computer Science student with a minor in management. My education uniquely combines tech skills with business insights. I specialize in web development, proficient in Java, JavaScript, and Python. My portfolio showcases my journey in creating user-friendly, efficient websites. I'm passionate about leveraging my technical expertise and management knowledge to build impactful digital solutions.

education.description:
In my degree, I've learned concepts in Interdisciplinary Management, Micro-Organizational Behaviour, Fundamentals of Computer Programming,
Object-Oriented Programming,
Principles of Software Development,
Data Structures and Algorithms,
Design for User Experience,
Basic Organization of Computer Systems,
File and Database Management

Volunteering & Leadership.title: Volunteer
Volunteering & Leadership.description: Joined a collaborative food drive effort, collecting and delivering significant food donations to local food banks, directly aiding in community hunger relief

Volunteering & Leadership.title: Web Application Developer Intern
Volunteering & Leadership.description:
- Conducted extensive research on peer reviews and determined problems associated with peer reviews in scholarly journals such as bias and misconduct.
- Developed, verified and validated a regression model using R that helps determine how the process of peer review could be structured to overcome the aforementioned problems.
- Created an interactive web application using JavaScript to allow authors and reviewers at ACM Digital Library to generate a dynamic checklist based on each type of empirical study in software engineering. 
- Maintained and documented the quality of code with accordance to software development practices such as commenting, indentation, debugging and refactoring. 
- Produced and delivered a technical report detailing the entire project and areas of future research at a workshop about software engineering hosted by Evaluation and Assessment in Software Engineering (EASE).

Volunteering & Leadership.company: Natural Sciences and Engineering Research Council of Canada (NSERC)
Volunteering & Leadership.title: Research Analyst Intern
Volunteering & Leadership.description:
Conducted extensive research on Agile software development predicting correlations between exogenous and endogenous variables using mathematical regression models in R.
 Brought forth a strong understanding of research methods and data analysis by performing case meta-analysis and statistical analysis on case studies that used Scrum practices.
 
 Documented a research paper for publishing detailing the entire project.
 Organized and prioritized work to complete tasks in timely, efficient manner.

projects.title: Halifax Explorer
projects.category: An engaging and user-friendly website to facilitate exploration of activities and eateries in Halifax,

projects.title: My Personal Website
projects.category: Developed a portfolio website using ReactJS

projects.title: FLight search
projects.category: Created an efficient search functionality to allow users to easily find flights based on specific criteria like destination or airport.
